subject: Sexual Health
title: Window Periods
description: A fast breakdown of Window Periods for builders.

hook.text: Test too early after exposure and you might get a false negative. Timing is everything.

buildup.text: The window period is the time between infection and when a test can reliably detect it.

discovery.text: HIV tests may need 2 to 4 weeks. Chlamydia tests are accurate after about 1 to 2 weeks.

twist.text: A negative result during the window period does not guarantee you are infection-free.

climax.text: Doctors recommend retesting after the window closes to confirm a true negative result.

punchline.text: When you test matters as much as whether you test.

quiz.question: What is a window period in STI testing?
options: Time between infection and reliable detection
